channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Canada loses measles elimination status after outbreaks
item.description: The Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) has notified the Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC) that Canada no longer holds measles elimination status.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The fight to be heard: 50 years of the James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement
item.description: This is part one of a three-part series from Radio-Canada about the 50th anniversary of the James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada loses measles elimination status
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ford government refuses to release completed work on Hwy. 401 tunnel idea
item.description: Ontario is refusing to release already completed work on the viability of Premier Doug Ford's Highway 401 tunnel vision after signing a $9.1 million contract to study it again.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Adds 323 Beds to Reduce Wait Times
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘You have to adapt': Punk rock concerts, wrestling events keep Calgary legion afloat
item.description: The Calgary No. 1 Branch, nestled among towering downtown office buildings along the busy light rail track, predates the legion itself.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Is Pierre Poilievre’s leadership in trouble?
item.description: After one MP crosses the floor, and another resigns completely, we look at the turmoil within the Conservative party, and what that means for Pierre Poilievre’s leadership.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Newfoundland's Between Breaths makes Western Canadian debut at the Firehall
item.description: A moving look at Dr. Jon Lien’s life, from rescuing whales to facing dementia.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 50 years later, why the wreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald haunts us still
item.description: The disaster, which was immortalized by Gordon Lightfoot's 1976 song 'The Wreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald,' has united Canadians and Americans across the Great Lakes.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Five underrated Halloween horror films for the spooky season's final stretch
item.description: From toy rabbits to punk-club green rooms, prepare to be scared.

item.title: Zappa Nite at the Rickshaw: Halloween comes early this Friday
item.description: “We do work hard to play his music well."

item.title: You Nearly Missed: Our top picks from the 2025 Chilliwack Independent Film Festival
item.description: From cult cinema to queer storytelling, five standout picks from this year’s program.

item.title: Photos: Shawn Mendes returns to Rogers Arena “proud to be Canadian”
item.description: It was an emotional night for Mendes and his fans.

item.title: The final scoop: Dolce Amore goes full service
item.description: Dolce Amore levels up from gelato empire to full-blown Italian affair.

item.title: Burton Cummings and Randy Bachman announce 2026 Canadian tour as the Guess Who
item.description: The legendary Canadian rock band will be kicking off its first tour in 23 years in Moncton on May 26, 2026.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: A farmer, her flock, and the North they sustain
item.description: In B.C’s North Coast, Kieran McKeown, a third-generation farmer, blends innovation, integrity, and community spirit to feed a region and keep her family’s legacy alive.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Glitch Theatre debuts with neurodivergent-led premiere
item.description: New name, new mandate, and a neurodivergent-led creative team define the company’s 2025 launch.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
item.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Peliplat steps up to back Vancouver's writing community
item.description: "The future of creativity is human."

item.title: We Stand on Guard Once More concert hoping 'to raise as much money as we can'
item.description: The sold-out concert featuring the best in Newfoundland and Labrador musical talent will be streamed across all local media channels this evening.
